title: Bills to beat Patriots? Michael Vick picks surprising Week 4 upset
text:
The Buffalo Bills welcome the New England Patriots to New Era Field on Sunday with first place in the AFC East at stake, and Michael Vick is picking the upset.

Yes, the former NFL quarterback is predicting Patriots quarterback Tom Brady will lose to the Bills for just the fourth time in 34 career starts against Buffalo.

Here is Vick's rationale from FOX Sports pre-game show.

Scroll to continue with content Ad

You heard it here first: @MichaelVick is picking the @BuffaloBills to stay undefeated after beating the Patriots today! pic.twitter.com/8n2KzLKMXG — FOX Sports: NFL (@NFLonFOX) September 29, 2019

The defending Super Bowl champions will be without star linebacker Dont'a Hightower in Week 4, but wide receiver Julian Edelman and running back Rex Burkhead both are active despite dealing with injuries this.

The Patriots have won five straight games against the Bills, and oddsmakers are expecting another New England victory (the spread is Pats by seven points). It's hard to blame them, too, especially when you consider the Patriots have outscored opponents by a combined score of 106-17 in their three wins.

Bills to beat Patriots? Michael Vick picks surprising Week 4 upset originally appeared on NBC Sports Boston
description: The Buffalo Bills welcome the New England Patriots to New Era Field on Sunday with first place in the AFC East at stake, and Michael Vick is predicting a huge upset win for the home team.
